item.title: Suible add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Suible add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Suible add a quote by Richard Powers
item.description: "Librarian is a service occupation. Gas station attendant of the mind." -- Richard Powers

item.title: Suible add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Do I contradict myself? Very well, then, I contradict myself; I am large -- I contain multitudes." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Suible add a quote by Leroy Brownlow
item.description: "There are times when silence has the loudest voice." -- Leroy Brownlow

item.title: Suible add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "People who want to share their religious views with you almost never want you to share yours with them." -- Dave Barry

item.title: Suible add a quote by Auguste Rodin
item.description: "Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely." -- Auguste Rodin

item.title: Suible add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "This will never be a civilized country until we expend more money for books than we do for chewing gum." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Suible add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Suible add a quote by Anne Michaels
item.description: "Love makes you see a place differently, just as you hold differently an object that belongs to someone you love. If you know one landscape well, you will look at all other landscapes differently. And if you learn to love one place, sometimes you can also learn to love another." -- Anne Michaels

item.title: Suible add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "We have a responsibility to stand watch over one another, we are watchers, all of us, watchers, guarding against the darkness." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Suible add a quote by John W. Whitehead
item.description: "Children are the living messages we send to a time we will not see." -- John W. Whitehead

item.title: Suible add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "The greatest tragedy of the family is the unlived lives of the parents." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Suible add a quote by Josh Billings
item.description: "To bring up a child in the way he should go, travel that way yourself once in a while." -- Josh Billings

item.title: Suible add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "And she finds it difficult to believe—that a person would love her even when she isn't trying. Trying to figure out what other people need, trying to be worthy." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Suible add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art.... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things which give value to survival." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Suible add a quote by Daniel Handler
item.description: "How do you forget something? You just walk away from it, those who are still alive. There are so few clearings in our hearts and minds, so few places where something can't grow on top of whatever happened to us before, and this is love too. " -- Daniel Handler

item.title: Suible add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Suible add a quote by Terry Pratchett
Suible add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Stories of imagination tend to upset those without one." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Suible add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I do note with interest that old women in my books become young women on the covers... this is discrimination against the chronologically gifted." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Suible add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Night poured over the desert. It came suddenly, in purple. In the clear air, the stars drilled down out of the sky, reminding any thoughtful watcher that it is in the deserts and high places that religions are generated. When men see nothing but bottomless infinity over their heads they have always had a driving and desperate urge to find someone to put in the way." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Suible add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Joy is to fun what the deep sea is to a puddle. It’s a feeling inside that can hardly be contained." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Suible add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Sometimes it's better to light a flamethrower than curse the darkness." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Suible add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It is said that your life flashes before your eyes just before you die. That is true, it's called Life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Suible add a quote by Scott Adams
item.description: "You're thinking I'm one of those wise-ass California vegetarians who is going to tell you that eating a few strips of bacon is bad for your health. I'm not. I say its a free country and you should be able to kill yourself at any rate you choose, as long as your cold dead body is not blocking my driveway." -- Scott Adams

item.title: Suible add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "Adventures do occur, but not punctually." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Suible add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "Let us think of people as starting life with an experience they forget and ending it with one which they anticipate but cannot understand." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Suible add a quote by Piers Anthony
item.description: "When you steal from the library, you are preventing anyone else from reading that book, and the very notion makes me want to drop you in the Void." -- Piers Anthony

item.title: Suible add a quote by Piers Anthony
item.description: "Every person professes to love good and hate evil, but in his actions his real preferences emerges." -- Piers Anthony
